message.content:
cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of video denoising, which is a common task in computer vision and image processing. The proposed solution involves decomposing the video into two layers, a low-rank matrix and a sparse matrix, and applying denoising algorithms on each layer separately. This approach involves techniques from computer vision (video block matching), machine learning (compressive sensing), information theory (sparse matrix decomposition), and signal processing (filtering). Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition), followed by cs.MM (Multimedia), cs.IT (Information Theory), cs.LG (Machine Learning), and cs.SI (Signal Processing).
